About ThunderSTORM

ThunderSTORM is an open-source plug-in for ImageJ, which provides automated processing of data acquired by single molecule localization microscopy methods such as PALM or STORM. The plugin includes a collection of methods for reducing noise, detection and sub-pixel localization of molecules, as well as post-processing steps such as drift correction, removing molecules with poor localization accuracy, and rendering of super-resolution images. ThunderSTORM also offers a set of tools for creation and analysis of simulated data. Our philosophy in developing ThunderSTORM has been to offer a collection of processing and post-processing methods so that users can adapt the analysis process to their data and to use all the advantages of ImageJ including its rich collection of other plug-ins, simple macro language and scripting support.

Project site

The latest version of ThunderSTORM, including source code and documentation, is available at Google code.

Report a bug

In the case of malfunction, please let us know by using the issue tracking system. Specify the malfunction and describe the procedure to reproduce the error. If an exception occurs, copy the stacktrace into the description box. In addition, specify your platform, i.e. Java version, ImageJ version, ThunderSTORM version, and possibly the version of your operating system.

Authors

This software is being developped at Institute of Cellular Biology and Pathology, First Faculty of Medicine, Charles University in Prague, Czech Republic by: Martin Ovesný, Pavel Křížek, Josef Borkovec, Zdeněk Švindrych, and Guy M. Hagen.
